content: /*<![CDATA[*/ $('#title').html($('meta[name=map-description]').attr('content')); /*]]>*/ 1.1.16 - Ensure that the scheduler.conf file ownership is set to root:root (Automated) Profile applicability: Level 1 - Master Node Ensure that the scheduler.conf file ownership is set to root:root. The scheduler.conf file is the kubeconfig file for the Scheduler. You should set its file ownership to maintain the integrity of the file. The file should be owned by root:root. Note By default, scheduler.conf file ownership is set to root:root. Audit Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the Control Plane node. stat -c %U:%G /etc/kubernetes/scheduler.conf Verify that the ownership is set to root:root. Remediation Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the Control Plane node. chown root:root /etc/kubernetes/scheduler.conf Â© 2025 Trend Micro Incorporated. All rights reserved.Search Knowledge Base
